text: Andrew Michael Spence (born November 7, 1943) is a Canadian American economist and recipient of the 2001 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences, along with George Akerlof and Joseph E. Stiglitz, for their work on the dynamics of information flows and market development. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:Scientists from New Jersey Category:People from Montclair, New Jersey
title: Michael Spence
